RakNet::Friends_Remove

RakNet::Friends_Remove Struct Reference
[Lobby2Commands]

Ends a friendship between two users. Remove from the database the friend entry between my handle and their handle. As with accept add friend invite, this is bidirectional. Either user can terminate the friendship. Store in the emails table from my handle to their handle the subject, body, and binary data, and procedure type flag. More...

virtual bool PrevalidateInput (void)

Detailed Description

Ends a friendship between two users. Remove from the database the friend entry between my handle and their handle. As with accept add friend invite, this is bidirectional. Either user can terminate the friendship. Store in the emails table from my handle to their handle the subject, body, and binary data, and procedure type flag.

Member Function Documentation

virtual bool RakNet::Friends_Remove::CancelOnDisconnect ( void   )  const [inline, virtual]

Should this message not be processed on the server if the requesting user disconnects before it completes? This should be true for functions that only return data. False for functions that affect other users, or change the database

True for input OK. False if the input is bad and does not need to be further processed in the database threads.

virtual bool RakNet::Friends_Remove::RequiresLogin ( void   )  const [inline, virtual]

Does this function require logging into the server before it can be executed? If true, the user id and user handle will be automatically inferred by the last login by looking up the sender's system address. If false, the message should include the username so the database query can lookup which user is performing this operation.
